column4: Measuring Three Vector Boson Couplings in $qq\to qqW$ at the SSC
column5:
latex (worldsci.sty file enclosed), 9 pages, 4 figures (uuencoded
  postscript figures in separate file), MAD/PH/789, FSU-HEP-930903, to appear
  in the Proceedings of the Workshop ``Physics at Current Accelerators and the
  Supercollider'', Argonne National Laboratory, June~2 --~5, 1993
column11:
We investigate the electroweak process $qq\to qqW$, {\it i.e.} $W$ production
via $W\gamma$ and $WZ$ fusion, as a probe for nonstandard $WW\gamma$ and $WWZ$
vertices at hadron supercolliders. Triggering on events with one very forward
and one very backward jet while requiring the $W$ decay lepton to be central,
strongly enhances the triple gauge boson vertex contribution and suppresses
backgrounds from QCD $Wjj$ events and $t\bar tj$ production below the signal
level. At the SSC, the process is sensitive to $WWV$, $V=\gamma\, ,Z$ couplings
$\kappa_V -1$, $\lambda_V$, and $g_1^Z$ in the $0.03\dots 0.1$ range.

column3: Avinash Dhar, Gautam Mandal and Spenta R. Wadia
column4:
$W_\infty$ coherent states and path-integral derivation of bosonization
  of non-relativistic fermions in one dimension
column5: 15 pages, tex (uses phyzzx macro), no figures
column11:
We complete the proof of bosonization of noninteracting nonrelativistic
fermions in one space dimension by deriving the bosonized action using
$W_\infty$ coherent states in the fermion path-integral. This action was
earlier derived by us using the method of coadjoint orbits. We also discuss the
classical limit of the bosonized theory and indicate the precise nature of the
truncation of the full theory that leads to the collective field theory.
